column1: Voskresensk (Russian: Воскресе́нск) is a town and the administrative center of Voskresensky District in Moscow Oblast
column3: located upon the banks of the Moskva River 88 kilometers (55 mi) southeast from Moscow. Population: 91

column1: It was founded in 1862. Town status was granted to it in 1938.
Within the framework of administrative divisions
column2: Voskresensk serves as the administrative center of Voskresensky District. As an administrative division
column5: incorporated within Voskresensky District as the Town of Voskresensk. As a municipal division
column6: the Town of Voskresensk is incorporated within Voskresensky Municipal District as Voskresensk Urban Settlement.

column1: There are station Voskresensk and stop platform 88 km at the Moscow-Ryazan line.
The town is home to several prominent ice hockey players
column2: including Igor Larionov and other Soviet national team players
column14: Roman Oksiuta and Valeri Zelepukin. Current Russian NHL players from Voskresensk include Andrei Markov
